Issues.Title: refactor(compiler-cli): add getTemplateOfComponent to TemplateTypeChecker
Issues.Body:
This commit adds a `getTemplateOfComponent` method to the
`TemplateTypeChecker` API, which retrieves the actual nodes parsed and used
by the compiler for template type-checking. This is advantageous for the
language service, which may need to query other APIs in
`TemplateTypeChecker` that require the same nodes used to bind the template
while generating the TCB.

Fixes #38352
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(compiler-cli): add getTemplateOfComponent to TemplateTypeChecker" (#38355)

Issues.Title: fix(forms): ensure to emit `statusChanges` on subsequent value update‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶ / validations

This commit ensures that the `updateValueAndValidity` method takes the
`asyncValidator` into consideration to emit on the `statusChanges` observables.
This is necessary so that any subsequent changes are emitted properly to any
subscribers.

Issues.Title: Ivy LS: API to access the component template
Issues.Body: For some of the `TemplateTypeChecker` APIs, it'll be necessary for the language service to use the "real" parsed template nodes, not just nodes independently parsed from the same template. That's because internally, the `TemplateTypeChecker` may need to look up information about the node in maps that are keyed on the node instance.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Ivy LS: API to access the component template" (#38352)

Issues.Title: Merge script to warn in case `feat` commits are present before merging into a patch branch
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

### Description
When merging PRs with multiple commits it's easy to miss a `feat` commit that may go into a patch branch accidentally. Since only `dev-infra` feature commits are allowed in patch branch, it'd be great to check all commits that are about to be merged to patch branch and warn caretaker in case there is a `feat` commit with a scope other than `dev-infra`.

// cc @josephperrott @devversion
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Merge script to warn in case `feat` commits are present before merging into a patch branch" (#38351)

Issues.Title: fix(router): ensure routerLinkActive updates when associated routerLinks change
Issues.Body:
This commit introduces a new subscription in the `routerLinkActive` directive which triggers an update
when any of its associated routerLinks have changes. `RouterLinkActive` not only needs to know when
links are added or removed, but it also needs to know about if a link it already knows about
changes in some way.

Quick note that `from...mergeAll` is used instead of just a simple
`merge` (or `scheduled...mergeAll`) to avoid introducing new rxjs
operators in order to keep bundle size down.

Fixes #18469
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(router): ensure routerLinkActive updates when associated routerLinks change" (#38349)

Issues.Title: fix(router): prevent calling unsubscribe on undefined subscription in RouterPreloader
Issues.Body:
Previously, the `ngOnDestroy` method called `unsubscribe` regardless of if `subscription` had
been initialized.  This can lead to an error attempting to call `unsubscribe` of undefined.
This change prevents this error, and instead only attempts `unsubscribe` when the subscription
has been defined.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(router): prevent calling unsubscribe on undefined subscription in RouterPreloader" (#38344)

Issues.Title: BrowserAnimationsModule not working properly with scrollPositionRestoration
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
This is possibly caused by the `BrowserAnimationsModule` from `@angular/platform-browser/animations`
### Description
Scroll position is not restoring properly when `BrowserAnimationsModule` is used in the project.
See the demo reproduction. Try commenting the `BrowserAnimationsModule` to see the difference.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-c4pgqm
Please note to see the scroll behaviour you need to open the stackblitz preview in a separate tab: https://angular-ivy-c4pgqm.stackblitz.io

### `BrowserAnimationsModule` enabled (results in incorrect behaviour :x: )
```ts
@NgModule({
  imports:      [ AppRoutingModule, BrowserModule, BrowserAnimationsModule], // <-- here
  declarations: [ AppComponent ],
  bootstrap:    [ AppComponent ]
})
export class AppModule { }
```
(incorrect behaviour demo)
![Peek 2020-08-04 16-52](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12165822/89288972-1da31980-d674-11ea-89f8-aca53a80fcc4.gif)

Sometimes it behaves correctly and sometimes it won't.

### `BrowserAnimationsModule` disabled (working properly :heavy_check_mark: )
```ts
@NgModule({
  imports:      [ AppRoutingModule, BrowserModule, /*BrowserAnimationsModule*/], // <-- here
  declarations: [ AppComponent ],
  bootstrap:    [ AppComponent ]
})
export class AppModule { }
```
Note that scroll position is retained here correctly when coming back to the route.
(expected behaviour)
![Peek 2020-08-04 16-55](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12165822/89289297-a02bd900-d674-11ea-9181-d126391a1173.gif)

## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version: 10.0.1** ( see stackblitz)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "BrowserAnimationsModule not working properly with scrollPositionRestoration" (#38341)

Issues.Title: zone.js incorrectly throws an error when rejecting a Promise with the `DISABLE_WRAPPING_UNCAUGHT_PROMISE_REJECTION` flag enabled
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package zone.js ### Is this a regression? No. ### Description Recently the flag `DISABLE_WRAPPING_UNCAUGHT_PROMISE_REJECTION` was added with #35873 to allow disabling of the wrapping behavior that zone.js performs on rejected promise values. Unfortunately, when this flag is enabled the zone.js code throws an unexpected error when a non-Error value is rejected, due to the code attempting to set various properties on the rejected value regardless of type: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/31796e8e2fa78fb55ae0c8bf461c4ad742898363/packages/zone.js/lib/common/promise.ts#L209-L212 For example, if I reject a Promise with the value "42" the following error occurs: `Error: Cannot create property 'rejection' on number '42'` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/zonejs-disable-promise-reject-wrapping-issue ## üî• Exception or Error If I reject a Promise with the value "42" the following error occurs: 

`Error: Cannot create property 'rejection' on number '42'`
This is reproducible with any non-error value (number, string, null, etc.) ## üåç Your Environment Stackblitz repro is Angular 10, but here is the output from my own project: **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 9.1.12
Node: 10.14.2
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 9.1.12
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core
... elements, forms, language-service, localize
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Issues.Title: fix(service-worker): fix the chrome debugger syntax highlighter
Issues.Body:
The Chrome debugger is not able to render the syntax properly when the
code contains backticks. This is a known issue in Chrome and they have an
open [issue](https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=659515) for that.

Issues.Title: production build of angular takes lot of time
Issues.Body:
I am trying to build my angular project and it takes lots of time(8+ minutes) for building. Below is my docker file. Image is created using Gitlab private runners.

```
FROM node:alpine as builder
WORKDIR /app
COPY .  /app
RUN cd /app && npm set progress=false && npm install
RUN cd /app && node --max_old_space_size=8192 node_modules/@angular/cli/bin/ng build --aot --prod

FROM nginx:alpine
RUN rm -rf /usr/share/nginx/html/*
COPY --from=builder /app/dist/fdm-apps /usr/share/nginx/html
COPY nginx/nginx-conf.conf /etc/nginx/nginx.conf
WORKDIR /usr/share/nginx/html

EXPOSE 80
CMD ["nginx", "-g", "daemon off;"]

```

Here is the angular configurations.

```
"optimization": true,
              "outputHashing": "all",
              "sourceMap": false,
              "extractCss": true,
              "namedChunks": false,
              "aot": true,
              "extractLicenses": true,
              "vendorChunk": false,
              "buildOptimizer": true,
              "budgets": [
                {

                  "maximumWarning": "3mb",
                  "maximumError": "5mb"
                },
                {

                }
              ]
```

Is there any way to bring down my build time?

Angular CLI: 9.1.6
Node: 12.18.3
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 9.1.9

Issues.Title: @angular/localize should have @babel/core as a devDependency
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
@angular/localize

### Is this a regression?
not sure

### Description
`@angular/localize` has `@babel/core` as a dependency, and not a devDependency.

We use BlackDuck for all the license attributions for the code we ship, but because `@babel/core` is include here, all the `@babel/*` and dependencies show up for BlackDuck to generate a report on, and include in our distributed license file even though none of that is browser code that will be shipped to users.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
* Create a new project: `ng create new-project`
* Add @angular/localize: `ng add @angular/localize`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "@angular/localize should have @babel/core as a devDependency" (#38329)

Issues.Title: Service workers registration breaks app in Safari
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/service-worker from at least v8.x till latest version ### Is this a regression? Nope, as far as i can tell the issue was always there ### Description Adding the package to an angular app and registering the module via importing ``` ServiceWorkerModule.register('ngsw-worker.js', { enabled: environment.production }) ``` breaks the app in safari with error ``` TypeError: undefined is not an object (evaluating 't.getSubscription') ``` The error is fired multiple times bringing the app to a crawl and eventually breaking Safari. After a refresh some times you get the following error also ``` Maximum call size exceeded ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/... ## üî• Exception or Error Error seems to come from the following line in the package https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/service-worker/src/push.ts#L151 In constructor of SwPush service the check if service workers is done like this: ``` constructor(private sw: NgswCommChannel) { if (!sw.isEnabled) { this.messages = NEVER; this.notificationClicks = NEVER; this.subscription = NEVER; return; } ``` Specifically for Safari it is the case that service workers are supported but Push API is not. A check like the following seems to be more complete and would guard against this error: ``` if (!sw.isEnabled && !('PushManager' in window || 'pushManager' in ServiceWorkerRegistration.prototype)) ``` ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 



Angular CLI: 8.3.13
Node: 12.13.0
OS: linux x64
Angular: 8.2.11
... common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Issues.Title: Not able to create new angular project on ppc64le
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [x ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Description I am trying to create a new angular project but while installing packages it gives segmentation fault. # version details: Angular CLI: 10.0.5 Node: 12.18.3 NPM: 6.14.6 OS: linux ppc64 ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ng new my-app ? Would you like to add Angular routing? Yes ? Which stylesheet format would you like to use? CSS CREATE my-app/README.md (1023 bytes) CREATE my-app/.editorconfig (274 bytes) CREATE my-app/.gitignore (631 bytes) CREATE my-app/angular.json (3566 bytes) CREATE my-app/package.json (1249 bytes) CREATE my-app/tsconfig.base.json (458 bytes) CREATE my-app/tsconfig.json (426 bytes) CREATE my-app/tslint.json (3184 bytes) CREATE my-app/.browserslistrc (853 bytes) CREATE my-app/karma.conf.js (1018 bytes) CREATE my-app/tsconfig.app.json (292 bytes) CREATE my-app/tsconfig.spec.json (338 bytes) CREATE my-app/src/favicon.ico (948 bytes) CREATE my-app/src/index.html (291 bytes) CREATE my-app/src/main.ts (372 bytes) CREATE my-app/src/polyfills.ts (2835 bytes) CREATE my-app/src/styles.css (80 bytes) CREATE my-app/src/test.ts (753 bytes) CREATE my-app/src/assets/.gitkeep (0 bytes) CREATE my-app/src/environments/environment.prod.ts (51 bytes) CREATE my-app/src/environments/environment.ts (662 bytes) CREATE my-app/src/app/app-routing.module.ts (245 bytes) CREATE my-app/src/app/app.module.ts (393 bytes) CREATE my-app/src/app/app.component.css (0 bytes) CREATE my-app/src/app/app.component.html (25757 bytes) CREATE my-app/src/app/app.component.spec.ts (1059 bytes) CREATE my-app/src/app/app.component.ts (210 bytes) CREATE my-app/e2e/protractor.conf.js (869 bytes) CREATE my-app/e2e/tsconfig.json (299 bytes) CREATE my-app/e2e/src/app.e2e-spec.ts (639 bytes) CREATE my-app/e2e/src/app.po.ts (301 bytes) ‚†º Installing packages...Segmentation fault (core dumped) ## üî• Exception or Error 

Segmentation fault (core dumped)
## üåç Your Environment 


Angular CLI: 10.0.5
Node: 12.18.3
OS: linux ppc64

Angular:
...
Ivy Workspace:

Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.1000.5
@angular-devkit/core         10.0.5
@angular-devkit/schematics   10.0.5
@schematics/angular          10.0.5
@schematics/update           0.1000.5
rxjs                         6.5.5
**Anything else relevant?** The issue is related to ppc64le architecture. On linux x86 architecture it is creating a new angular project.

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular/devkit-build-angular): simplify Webpack split chunks configuration
Issues.Body: By leveraging the chunks function filter option, the test option can be reduced to only a regular expression instead of the more complex function.  This change also provides support for Webpack 5.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(@angular/devkit-build-angular): simplify Webpack split chunks configuration" (#18432)

Issues.Title: perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): lazy load several optional webpack plugins
Issues.Body: Multiple Webpack plugins are only used when certain options are enabled.  By only requiring them when needed, startup time can be reduced by potentially eliminating large dependency hierarchies from being loaded that will then be unused.  This change currently only applies to plugins that are required.  This limitation is due to the current webpack configuration infrastructure being synchronous which prevents dynamic import usage.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): lazy load several optional webpack plugins" (#18431)

Issues.Title: Library randomly fails to build consistently, but reports no errors
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [X ] build ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 8.x ### Description I have an Angular library that I've been trying to update to Angular 10.x. I've noticed that, even without making ANY changes to the library code, it will randomly build differently. I can build it 10 times in a row without making any changes to the code and approximately 50% of the time (or more), it will build in such a way that causes a client application to fail to build. It's important to note that the library itself always appears to build successfully - it produces no noticeable errors. I'm using the "--prod" flag every time to build it with the View engine instead of Ivy. However, the code only works when the dist build includes an "__ivy_ngcc__" directory and a file that ends with ".__ivy_ngcc_bak". There may be other differences in the dist contents as well, but those are the ones that immediately stand out. If the build process fails to produce output that contains those 2 items, then an Angular app that consumes the library fails to build. The consuming application produces errors that say: `ERROR in The target entry-point "[library name]" has missing dependencies:` followed by a long list of items (services, pipes, interfaces, etc.) from the library that it thinks are "missing". I can resolve this by simply rebuilding the library, then the client app several times until the library contains the "ivy_ngcc" items mentioned above - at which point the client app that consumes the library will build successfully. Again... it is my understanding that the "--prod" flag makes the code build with View, not Ivy. So I'm not sure why it ever produces the "ivy_ngcc" items and I'm not sure why it only works when they are present. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Unfortunately, my library is almost 100% proprietary code so I can make it publicly available for testing. However, I can describe the approach that I've taken: 1) I built a brand new workspace, per the Angular library documentation 2) I added a library to the workspace and added a large number of items (services, etc.), contained in about 6 modules. 3) I added a test application to the workspace, which references the library (directly via filesystem reference - not through NPM yet) 4) I'm simply repeating the following commands to test: `ng build my-lib --prod` `ng build my-app` ## üåç Your Environment 


Node: 12.7.0
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 10.0.6
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Issues.Title: > It happen to me today. Ubuntu, Angular 8, Bootstrap 3.
Issues.Body:
> It happen to me today. Ubuntu, Angular 8, Bootstrap 3.
> Firstly I resolved it by adding `@import "~bootstrap/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css";` into styles.css but then I decided to look more into it and I compare angular.json file one from the previous projects where Bootstrap 3 was loading without issues. It is only that "Meld" (compare tool) reveled to me that in a hurry erroneously I added path to the bootstrap ` "styles": [ "node_modules/bootstrap/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css", "src/styles.css" ],`
> under the **"test"** section instead under "architect" section.
> Once moved to ""architect" section, bootstrap started loading.

Thanks i have the same problem and it's work now

_Originally posted by @MohamedAbdeljelil in https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/3411#issuecomment-522493940_

Issues.Title: feat(cdk/scrolling): extend CdkVirtualForOf to work with iterables
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Currently `CdkVirtualForOf` supports data from an `Array`, `Observable<Array>`, or `DataSource`. I would like it to support data from an `Iterable` as well. This would match the behavior of `NgForOf` which supports elements of both `T[]` and `Iterable<T>`. 

According to the documentation at https://material.angular.io/cdk/scrolling/overview#creating-items-in-the-viewport, `*cdkVirtualFor` supports the exact same API as `*ngFor`. However `*ngFor` supports iterables while `*cdkVirtualFor` does not.

See https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-bnbcza?file=src%2Fapp%2Fcdk-virtual-scroll-context-example.html for an example. In the linked example, using `cdkVirtualFor` does not render the set, while `ngFor` does render the set.

#### Use Case

This would make `cdkVirtualFor` closer to `ngFor`. I'm happy to try to implement this myself and create a PR, although I don't know how involved that would be.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(cdk/scrolling): extend CdkVirtualForOf to work with iterables" (#20210)

Issues.Title: bug(autocomplete): Autocomplete's overlay panel overlaps element's which are in front of the input when scrolling
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

See: https://material.angular.io/components/autocomplete/overview

![cdk-panel-overlap](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15352422/89488800-dea9bc80-d776-11ea-8664-c3004962313b.gif)


Steps to reproduce:
1. Open link
2. Focus any autocomplete input and have option panel open
3. Scroll down until you see autocomplete's option panel overlap the page's header
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

Panel should not overlap header, is this even possible based on how the CDK panel is rendered as a separate overlay layer in the DOM? I suspect this is a technical limitation.

An alternative to fixing this is to make autocomplete match mat-select's panel's behaviour -- no scrolling is possible at all if the mat-select's panel is open. This is not the case with mat-autocomplete's panel, perhaps it should be. 


#### Actual Behavior

Panel overlaps header


#### Environment

- Angular: Version should not matter
- CDK/Material: 10.1.2 (also occurs on 9.1.2) (and I'm assuming versions before and between those too stated version as well)
- Browser(s): Firefox, Chrome, Should not matter
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Should not matter, Ubuntu, Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(autocomplete): Autocomplete's overlay panel overlaps element's which are in front of the input when scrolling" (#20209)

Issues.Title: build: fix release output containing invalid imports sometimes
Issues.Body:
A very subtle issue has surfaced in our release output. Based on
previous builds that have been performed locally by the caretaker
performing the release, the release output might differ and contain
invalid module imports that break ES2015 output.

Notably the es2015 output is not primarily used by the CLI. It uses
the flat ES2015 output instead.

The issue surfaces because of a bug in `@bazel/typescript` where the
`moduleName` for source files is leaking between TSC worker runs. This
means that source files are incorrectly referenced by module name,
instead of relative path when the prodmode ES2015 output is built.
Deep paths to source files are not supported as per Angular Package format.

We patch the fix that is pending upstream to ensure our release output
works: https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_typescript/pull/504. Once the
fix upstream lands (which might take quite some time; given g3 sync and
sync with the rules_nodejs repository), we can remove the patch and
update to the latest version of `@bazel/typescript`.

Fixes #20179.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: fix release output containing invalid imports sometimes" (#20201)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-snack-bar): Default options are ignored when opening a snack bar from component
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-23ur6d

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a component and use the `MAT_SNACK_BAR_DEFAULT_OPTIONS` injection token to inject default settings into either the component being used in `snackBar.openFromComponent()` or the module's providers
2. Open the snackbar

#### Actual Behavior

#### Environment

- CDK/Material: 10.1.0
- Browser(s): Chrome

Issues.Title: feat(MatSelect): Add an option to search from the beginning of the options when typing
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Add an option to MatSelect to search the entire option list when typing.

#### Use Case

MatSelect allows jumping to an option when the list is open and the user starts typing. This is great however the current implementation only tries to match options after the currently selected option. While this may be useful in some cases, in others it might force the user to use the mouse or arrow keys and it also differs in behaviour from the native `<select>` tag.

The following example has both a MatSelect and a native select with options going from 0 to 150: [https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-rb2rje?file=src%2Fapp%2Fselect-overview-example.ts](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-rb2rje?file=src%2Fapp%2Fselect-overview-example.ts)

The following steps highlight the expected scenario:
- Open select
- Type '1'
- Wait a little
- Type '5'
- Wait a little
- Type '1' again 

The active option will be '10' on MatSelect (since it only searches in options that are after the currently selected option) and '1' on the native select.

In this scenario, the only way to go back to values before 10 is either using the arrow keys or the mouse.

It'd be great if MatSelect had an option to mimic the native select's behaviour and search the entire list.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(MatSelect): Add an option to search from the beginning of the options when typing" (#20199)

Issues.Title: build: create script for building docs-content
Issues.Body:
Creates a script that builds the docs-content. We also use
that script in the our CI setup to reduce duplication.

The script will not pack the package by default, as that is
up to the consumer of the script and we do don't do it
for other release packages. It's totally fine just adding a package
directory to a project (similar to a tarball).

<sup>My concern with packing in those scripts is that it will unnecessarily
slow down builds on CI and packing is not necessarily fast for large packages</sup>
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: create script for building docs-content" (#20198)

Issues.Title: feat(drag-drop): prevent a item be removed when it into another container
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

CDK(V9) provide `[cdkDropListEnterPredicate]` to prevent a item into another container, provide `(cdkDropListDropped)` to determine how to do when user drop the item. 

I found when user drag the item into another container but not to release, the item is removed in origin container. When I release it, I didn't add `(cdkDropListDropped)`, so the item is recovered. But what I want is the item can into another container but not to be removed in any time. 

In summary, can you provide `(cdkDragLeaved)` to determine how to deal with the item when the item into another container?
 
#### Use Case

Just imaging you are ordering foods from menu in the restaurant. You need to drag the food into your shopping cart. But the item of the menu should't be removed.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30228406/89366962-7e7d3100-d70a-11ea-8ae0-c7057039dc66.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(drag-drop): prevent a item be removed when it into another container" (#20194)

Issues.Title: fix(material/progress-spinner): progress-spinners with diameter less than or equal to 10
Issues.Body:
As @paulferaud pointed out in #19469, using `BASE_STROKE_WIDTH` when calculating the spinner circle radius is causing issues, such as the progress spinner becoming invisible if the diameter is less than or equal to 10.

One solution is to change the radius calculation for diameters less than 11 and subtract a fraction of the diameter instead of `BASE_STROKE_WIDTH`. 

This also maintains the current behaviour for any diameters above 10, so shouldn‚Äôt cause breaking screenshot tests.

Fixes #19469
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/progress-spinner): progress-spinners with diameter less than or equal to 10" (#20193)

Issues.Title: fix(material/progress-spinner): Progress spinner animation fails for floating point diameter values
Issues.Body:
The spinner diameter is used in the `animation-name` CSS property for the indeterminate spinner `circle` element. If the diameter is a floating point value the animation name will include a period ‚Äò.‚Äô character e.g. `animation-name-90.6`. Period characters are not supported for the animation-name property - see https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation-name.

Replacing the period character in the diameter string with an underscore fixes this issue e.g. `animation-name-90_6`

Fixes #20158
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/progress-spinner): Progress spinner animation fails for floating point diameter values" (#20192)

Issues.Title: feat(button-toggle): Add support for radio-button interaction pattern
Issues.Body:
`MatButtonToggle` and `MatButtonToggleGroup` previously use either a native checkbox or a radio button depending on whether the control had multiple selection. We changed this to always using a native `<button>` element with `aria-pressed` partially based on this [article by Heydon Pickering](https://inclusive-components.design/toggle-button).

I was recently given some feedback from a from a screen-reader user that, while `button[aria-pressed]` and checkbox are effectively interchangeable, using the radio-button interaction pattern is preferable for single-selection in a lot of cases. As such, we should re-add support for the radio-button pattern. I'm imagining we can do this similarly to how we support multiple interaction pattern in other components (e.g. list, chips) via selector, potentially something like
```html
<mat-button-toggle-radio-group aria-label="Text alignment">
  <mat-button-toggle-radio>Left</mat-button-toggle-radio>
  <mat-button-toggle-radio>Center</mat-button-toggle-radio>
  <mat-button-toggle-radio>Right</mat-button-toggle-radio>
</mat-button-toggle-radio-group>
```

This variant should use a native `<input type="radio">` in its template so that we get the correct keyboard interaction for free.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(button-toggle): Add support for radio-button interaction pattern" (#20190)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-select): Multi-option MatSelect does not apply theme to checkboxes
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-zdpomd?file=src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.html

Steps to reproduce:
1. Set up a `mat-select` with `multiple="true"` and set the `color` attribute to something other than primary
2. Check one of the options in the `mat-select`
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?

The checkboxes should match the color attribute.

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
The checkboxes are always styled with the primary color.

#### Environment

- Angular: 10.0.1
- CDK/Material: 10.0.1 (also present in 9.1.2)
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows

This issue was [raised](https://github.com/angular/components/issues/6079) and [fixed](https://github.com/angular/components/pull/6082) 3 years ago, but it seems to have regressed.

As a workaround, we can pass the class `mat-accent` to the `panelClass` property, but that also affects the color of the `mat-option` text which is not desirable (see second example in the reproduction).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(mat-select): Multi-option MatSelect does not apply theme to checkboxes " (#20187)

Issues.Title: When a radio button is both checked and disabled tabindex wouldn't step into the radio group at all
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material-radio-button-demo-wz3p6o?file=app%2Fapp.component.html

Steps to reproduce:
1. Have a radio button which is both checked and disabled
2. try to navigate to radio group through tab
 
 
#### Expected Behavior
If checked radio button is also disabled the tab should navigate you to the first enabled radio button (even if is not checked)

#### Actual Behavior
If checked radio button is also disabled radio group is not navigable through keyboard

- Angular:
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "When a radio button is both checked and disabled tabindex wouldn't step into the radio group at all" (#20184)

I have a table where one of the cells contains a google chart component, I'd like to hide/show the component depending on row scrolling in out of viewport.
Looking at the documentation I cannot find the way to do this but this feels like something very basic so I apparently missing something.

Issues.Title: CDK Overlay - Panel position incorrect after applying transform: scale
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-ceaw9i

Steps to reproduce:
1.  Use any Angular material component having panel (such as select)
2.  Apply transform: scale on the page (for cross-browser zooming purpose)
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

Panel of the component should be positioned accordingly after applying scaling


#### Actual Behavior

Panel is positioned incorrectly.


#### Environment

- Angular: 10.0.1
- CDK/Material: 10.1.2
- Browser(s): Google Chrome  84.0.4147.105
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  Windows 10

![cdk-overlay-issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13291820/89305044-c90b9880-d68b-11ea-8306-eec244bfb95b.png)
